answers.answer: Check it frequently, he may be pre diabetic..But you should check it 2 hrs after any meals and it should always be 140 or less andything higher is prediabetic or Diabetes.. If the Ketones in his urine was too high Im sure the DR would of been concerned..Just keep a eye on him and wait 2 hrs after a meal so if it's 200 then for sure seek help!

question: My son had a urine test done this morning (not for diabetes) and it showed Ketones in his urine. Since diabetes is prevalent in my family, I tested his blood sugar, and it was 9.8 (177). This was about 20-30 minutes after he ate 1/2 a pop tart. Should we be concerned, or just write it off as being high from the pop tart?
title: Looking for some advice for my 3 year old...
